segment: Miami New Times, LLC    This Privacy Policy is effective as of February 15, 2012.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment provides an effective date for the privacy policy, serving as an introductory or generic statement without detailing specific practices.

segment: This Privacy Policy describes the practices that Miami New Times, LLC ("Miami New Times") follows with respect to the collection, maintenance and use of information submitted on miaminewtimes.com (the "Site"). This Privacy Policy applies only to information we collect from this Site, and does not apply to any other website or business activity of Miami New Times. By using our Site, and/or providing information to us, you consent to the collection, maintenance and use of this information by us.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment provides a general introduction to the privacy policy, specifying the scope and applicability of the policy to the Miami New Times website.

segment: If you do not agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy, please do not use the Site and exit immediately. We reserve the right to modify or amend the terms of this Privacy Policy from time to time. Your continued use of the Site following the posting of changes to these terms means that you accept those changes. We will give you notice of the revised Privacy Policy by posting the revised policy on the Site and by revising the "effective date" set forth above.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the right to modify the privacy policy and indicates that changes will be notified by posting on the site, implying a privacy relevant change with a general notice on the website. No specific user choice is offered beyond continued use implying acceptance.

segment: Information We Collect    We collect and maintain personally identifiable information and automatic information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the company collects personally identifiable information and automatic information, which suggests collection on their website.

segment: Personally Identifiable Information    "Personally identifiable information" is information that tells us who you are, such as your name, screen name, email address, postal address, phone number, credit card information, birth date/year and gender.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment defines 'Personally identifiable information' which includes personal identifiers like name, email, and credit card information.

segment: Miami New Times collects and maintains personally identifiable information about you only when you provide it to us. For example, we may collect and maintain personally identifiable information about you when you register for or participate in contests, sweepstakes, promotions, polls, surveys, newsletters and text messages (including contests, sweepstakes, promotions, polls, surveys, newsletters and text messages of certain third parties). We may also collect and maintain personally identifiable information when you post an ad, submit comments to the Site or letters to the editor, submit events for inclusion on our Site, purchase event tickets from us, or otherwise provide it to us when you contact us.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how Miami New Times collects personally identifiable information directly from users when they voluntarily provide it through various interactions on their website. The collection is explicit as users provide their information when engaging in activities like registering for contests or posting ads.

segment: If you do not provide information to us, you may be unable to use certain features of the Site. For example, you cannot post comments in connection with certain articles or register for the Site, contests, surveys or newsletters unless you provide certain information. Also, you will not be able to submit events for inclusion on our Site or purchase event tickets if you do not provide certain information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment explains that certain features of the site require users to provide specific information, indicating collection on the website.

segment: Automatic Information and Cookies    "Automatic information" is information automatically collected whenever you visit our site. For example, automatic information includes information collected by our web server (which may be hosted by a third party) that your web browser makes available whenever you visit our Site, such as your browser type and capabilities, network properties, the site that you visited before viewing our Site, content viewed on the Site, and your geographic location. We currently use, or may use, such information in various ways:

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of automatic information by the web server whenever a user visits the site, which falls under the category of collecting information on the website.

segment: Aggregated data: We maintain automatic information in aggregated form, not associated with your IP address or personally identifiable information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies that the data is maintained in an aggregated form and not associated with personally identifiable information, indicating it is anonymized.

segment: IP address tracking: All computers and servers on the Internet use IP addresses to recognize and communicate with each other. We collect and maintain IP addresses to administer and analyze our Site and report aggregate information (such as how many visitors we have and how many visitors see and click on particular advertisements).

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of IP addresses on the website for the purpose of site administration and analytics, specifically mentioning aggregate reporting, indicating anonymized use.

segment: We may associate your IP address with your personally identifiable information and may maintain, use and disclose such information in accordance with the terms of this Privacy Policy below.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses associating IP addresses with personally identifiable information, indicating collection and identifiability of data on their website, but does not specify the purpose or user type.

segment: Cookies: This Site uses "cookies." "Cookies" are small text files that allow websites to store and retrieve information about you from your computer system. Miami New Times does serve cookies to track individual site usage for later aggregation and for other purposes explained in this policy. You are always free to decline our cookies if your browser permits, but you may not be able to take full advantage of our Site's features if you do.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of cookies on the website to track individual site usage, which falls under first-party collection. Users have the choice to decline cookies via browser settings, indicating a collection choice scope with browser/device privacy controls. The purpose is for analytics/research as it mentions tracking site usage.

segment: We do not and cannot use cookies or IP address tracking to retrieve personally identifiable information from your computer.

model_analysis.explanation: The statement clarifies that the company does not use cookies or IP address tracking to collect personally identifiable information, indicating a lack of identifiable data collection through these means.

segment: Online Behavioral Advertising. Miami New Times may tailor advertisements on the Site to a user's apparent interests, based on user browsing activity. That is, ads may be displayed for you on the Site based on the pages and content that you view. This is sometimes known as first-party online behavioral advertising. Also, your viewing activity on the Site may be shared with advertising networks, so that they can display ads for you, which they believe will interest you, on other sites, not affiliated with Miami New Times. This is sometimes known as third-party online behavioral advertising. Miami New Times attempts to deal with advertising networks that are members of the Network Advertising Initiative or the Digital Advertising Alliance, but at times ad networks that are not NAI or DAA participants may have access to your activity on the Site, and hence may use that information in connection with displaying ads to you on other sites.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how user viewing activity on the site may be shared with advertising networks for third-party online behavioral advertising.

segment: Advertising networks that are members of Network Advertising Initiative or that participate in the Digital Advertising Alliance have subscribed to certain principles relating to collection and use of information, and may permit users to direct whether or how information about their viewing activities are used for advertising purposes. To register your preferences or choices, or to opt out of behavioral advertising offered by participants in these programs, visit http://www.networkadvertising.org or http://www.aboutads.info.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how users can opt out of behavioral advertising by visiting specific links, indicating a choice control related to third-party sharing/collection for advertising purposes.

segment: If you change browsers or computers, or delete the cookies on your computer, you may need to re-enter your preferences or opt-out.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the need to re-enter preferences or opt-out if cookies are deleted, indicating control over cookies and tracking elements.

segment: Web Beacons: The Site uses web beacons, which provide website operators and third parties a means to deliver a graphic image on a web page or in an email message for the purpose of gathering data. The Site uses web beacons to gather automatic information such as the duration of a visit to the Site, the web pages viewed, a user's geographical information (e.g., city, state, zip code), IP address, and type of web browser.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of web beacons to collect data such as visit duration, pages viewed, geographical information, IP address, and browser type, which falls under first-party collection on the website for analytics and research purposes.

segment: Use and Disclosure of Information    We maintain and use personally identifiable information for the purpose or purposes for which it is provided and for purposes specified in this Privacy Policy. For example, we may maintain and use personally identifiable information to send newsletters and text messages that you have opted to receive; to establish your online account and recognize you when you return to the Site; to contact you regarding contests, promotions, polls, and surveys; to complete the sale of event tickets; to provide customer support; or to otherwise communicate with you regarding our Site, an ad you posted, an event you submitted to the Site, or your comments or letters to the editor.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of personally identifiable information collected on the website for various purposes like sending newsletters, establishing accounts, and providing customer support. Users opt-in to receive communications, indicating explicit collection and identifiable information.

segment: We may also maintain and use your personally identifiable information to attribute your comments, letters to the editor and/or other submissions to the Site to you. As has traditionally been the case with our print editions, we may require that you supply certain information to us (such as your real name, daytime telephone number and/or e-mail address) in connection with comments and other submissions to the Site. That is because we may need to contact you, and because your identity may be important to understand your point of view. If you send us comments or other submissions, we reserve the right to publish them in print or display them on this Site in full or in edited form. We normally honor requests to withhold your name and address when provided in connection with comments and other submissions, both in print and on-line, but we reserve the right to use, discuss and report facts that we consider newsworthy relating to submissions even if it might reveal or tend to reveal the poster's identity.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection and use of personally identifiable information for attributing user comments and submissions on the site, requiring explicit provision of contact information for service operation purposes.

segment: We may combine personally identifiable information and automatic information we obtain from you or your activities with other data concerning or relating to the behavioral and demographic attributes of our customers, in order to identify our best customers, reach them effectively, understand their interests and best manage our relationships with them.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the combination of personally identifiable information with other data to analyze customer behavior and demographics for better relationship management, indicating collection and use on the website with identifiable data for research purposes.

segment: We may also use personally identifiable information to send you advertisements, promotions and information about the Site, Miami New Times and our partners.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that personally identifiable information will be used to send advertisements, promotions, and information, which falls under the purpose of advertising.

segment: We may disclose personally identifiable information in special cases when we have reason to believe that disclosing this information is necessary to identify, contact, or bring legal action against someone who may have breached our Terms of Use or who may be causing injury to or interference with (either intentionally or unintentionally) our rights or property, other users of our Site, or anyone else who could be harmed by such activities. We may also disclose personally identifiable information when we reasonably believe that the law requires it.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes disclosing personally identifiable information to identify or take legal action against individuals violating terms or causing harm, and when required by law.

segment: If you chose to provide your personally identifiable information for the purposes of a third-party contest, promotion, poll, survey or newsletter, your personally identifiable information will be given to Miami New Times and to the third-party advertiser/sponsor involved with the relevant contest, promotion, poll, survey or newsletter and/or its agents and affiliates. For rules or requirements for contests, promotions, polls, surveys and/or newsletters, please see the applicable page on our Site.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing personally identifiable information with Miami New Times and third-party advertisers/sponsors when users participate in contests, promotions, polls, surveys, or newsletters.

segment: We occasionally have third party agents, subsidiaries, affiliates and joint ventures that perform functions on our behalf, such as credit card processing, shipping or stocking orders, providing customer service, data combination, etc. They are provided access to personally identifiable information needed to perform their functions.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing personally identifiable information with third parties, such as agents and affiliates, for operational purposes like credit card processing and customer service.

segment: In the event of a sale of Miami New Times or a sale of substantially all Miami New Times assets, personally identifiable information may be one of the business assets transferred or sold.

Policy Change.Change Type: In case of merger or acquisition

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the transfer or sale of personally identifiable information as part of a business asset in the event of a sale of the company, which fits the scenario of a merger or acquisition.

segment: We may maintain and use automatic information to track how our visitors use the Site, study traffic patterns, and run and maintain the site, and we and other third parties may provide targeted advertisements to you based on such data.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of 'automatic information' to track visitor usage and study traffic patterns, which falls under analytics/research purposes. The data is collected implicitly as users navigate the site.

segment: We may share aggregated data with our advertisers and other marketing and business partners.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that aggregated data is shared with advertisers and other marketing and business partners, which falls under third-party sharing for marketing purposes. The data is described as aggregated, meaning it is not identifiable.

segment: This Privacy Policy does not apply to any information you choose to make public.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies that the privacy policy does not apply to information that users choose to make public, indicating a practice or type of data not covered by the policy.

segment: Opt-Out    You may terminate any ongoing communications you receive from Miami New Times via e-mail (such as newsletters, subscriptions, contest results, survey inquiries, etc.) by (1) clicking the "unsubscribe" link that is available within the communication received, or (2) through your online profile.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how users can opt-out of receiving communications from Miami New Times by using an 'unsubscribe' link or through their online profile, which pertains to first party use of personal information.

segment: Children    Some of the material on this Site is for mature audiences, and parents and guardians should take responsibility for monitoring their children's use of the Site. Children under the age of 13 should not use this Site. We do not intentionally collect personally identifiable information from users of the Site who are under the age of thirteen.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies that children under the age of 13 should not use the site and that the site does not intentionally collect personal information from users under 13, indicating a focus on children's privacy.

segment: Links to Other Sites    This Site provides links to websites maintained by other organizations. Miami New Times provides these links as a convenience to users, but it does not operate, control or endorse such sites. Miami New Times also disclaims any responsibility for the information on those sites and any products or services offered on such sites. Please review the privacy policies of these sites. Miami New Times is not responsible for any actions or policies of such third parties, and does not make any warranties or representations that any linked sites (or even this Site) will function without error or interruption, that defects will be corrected, or that the sites and their servers are free of viruses and other problems that can harm your computer. Miami New Times disclaims any responsibility for transactions conducted on those sites and cannot vouch for the security of the information submitted in those transactions.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the disclaimer of responsibility for third-party sites linked from the Miami New Times site. It emphasizes that Miami New Times does not control these sites and advises users to review their privacy policies, indicating a practice not directly covered by their own privacy policy.

segment: E-Commerce and Our Secure Server    We use reasonable efforts to protect your personally identifiable information from unauthorized use or disclosure. Unfortunately, information transmitted on the Internet and/or stored on systems attached to the Internet are not 100% secure. Updates and Changes to Your Information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes efforts to protect personally identifiable information but acknowledges the inherent insecurity of internet-based systems, which fits under generic data security measures.

segment: If your personally identifiable information changes, you may correct and/or update it by sending us an email. You may also view, correct and/or update your personally identifiable information by accessing your profile on the Site.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the ability for users to view, correct, and update their personally identifiable information through their profile on the site or by contacting via email, indicating access and edit capabilities for users with accounts.

segment: More Questions-    If you have any questions about this privacy policy, please e-mail them to privacyadministrator@voicemediagroup.com, and be sure to indicate the specific site you are visiting and the nature of your question or concern.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment provides contact information for users to ask questions about the privacy policy, which falls under privacy contact information.
